zone.line: And heard, & cried--ah woe is me!
And died as mad as the wild waves be
By such dread words from Earth to Heaven
My still realm was never riven
When its wound was closed, there stood
Darkness oer the Day {,} like blood.
And we shrank back--for dreams of ruin
To frozen caves our flight pursuing
Made us keep silence--thus--& thus--
Though silence is as hell to us
they pass with a terrible sound
Prometheus
I hear a sound of voices--not the voice
Which I gave forth. O Mother dare thy sons
Scorn him without whom, by the might of Jove
Both they & thou had vanished like thin mist
ye me
Unrolled on the morning wind!--Know they not
agony
The Titan, he who made his su misery
your
The barrier to thier else all conquering foe?
O -fed
113 Ye rock-embosomed Lawn{s} & snowing stream{s}
